Europa League Semi-Final: Bilbao - Man United

Interesting lineup in the EL semi's tonight.
Bilbao's unstoppable at home, boasting 6 wins out of 6, a true fortress in the Basque Country. Meanwhile, United's away stats are very underwhelming.

Who will be United's Trojan Horse?👀
After @endgame_summit and @token2049, Score is at @astonvilla today for the Transfer Forum!

our kingdom is where alpha lives.

Great subnet positioning exercise

Product-focused <> Commodity-focused

That’s the $TAO spectrum 

Check where’s 44, do you agree with @brodydotai?

re subnet building & positioning--

i view it as a spectrum between:

a) product-focused, niche use case, unimodal, fully verticalized, limited TAM

vs

b) commodity-focused, mass market, serving as a foundational element for broad application integration

both approaches have their pros/cons

for a), pmf is found much quicker, but has limited upside

for b), disruption is much greater, upside is uncapped.

bittensor needs both, it has both, and thats the beauty of it.

The Comeback Kids 💪

When comparing the 1st and 2nd half of the season, these teams improved most in terms of xG and xG Conceded (inverted x-axis).

Valencia stood out overall, climbing out of the relegation zone. Everton and Wolves significantly tightened up their defence.

Der Rekordmeister going for #24 🏆

Bayern can clinch their 24th title with a win over Leipzig. With 11 wins in 21 previous matchups, it’s almost a toss-up.

Fun fact: Coman (playing as a sub) can win his 13th league title in 13 seasons.

Will Bayern lift the trophy today?

arsenal leads 1–0. second half is in.

expect at least one more goal, but not a shootout.

btts? unlikely. bournemouth looks quiet.

2–0 or 1–0 final looks sharp.

clean sheet is on the table.

edge is in control.

Real Madrid vs Celta de Vigo

With Vini and Mbappé leading most attacks, Madrid predominantly enters the box from the left flank.

Celta plays more balanced through the middle, targeting  Borja Iglesias, who scored 9 goals this season.

Can Madrid keep their title hopes alive?

Best Center Backs Across Top 5 European Leagues

With 4 assists and most successful defensive and offensive actions per 90', Dortmund's Schlotterbeck is in a league of his own.

Iñigo Martínez's line-breaking passes are key to Flick's buildup play in Barça's hunt for the Treble.

Impressing across the board, young Spanish international and Bournemouth star Dean Huijsen is set for a major transfer by season's end.

And we're big fans of @DreadBong0 

He definitely has the V I S I O N

Thanks for your support legend 🫡

I'm a big fan of @webuildscore on subnet 44 and have been buying since Day 1 of #dTAO

Naturally gravitated towards them as..

1. I'm a lifelong football fan.. even though Spurs are currently testing my patience

2. Obsessed with Football Manager type games for the past 27 years and understand how data plays a large part in success

3. Smaller clubs often lack access to quality analytics.. building a faster, cheaper and more robust system levels the playing field and opens many doors

4. Been keenly aware how clubs like Brighton and Brentford have been able to successfully implement the Moneyball philosophy and turn smart data into a real competitive advantage in the Prem

5. The total addressable market for sports analytics is massive.. and it's only going up from here

6. The team genuinely seems like good, mission driven builders

A blend of passion, unique use case among current #Bittensor subnets and a large market ripe for disruption

Barça have just 1 win in 5 UCL games at San Siro against Inter (W1 D2 L2), they’ll need to break that pattern to book a spot in the final.

Big future ahead?

expected: 2+ goals in this one (84.8% chance). btts in play if the tempo holds.

my ai model still sees barça with the edge to win this.
one more goal likely. most of it points their way.

PSG with a narrow 1-0 lead into the second leg.

Goalkeepers Donnaruma (72.3%) and Raya (75.7%) boast strong save percentages, leading to 2.12 and 4.8 expected goals prevented, respectively. Crucial!

Will we witness another thriller tonight?👀

Score Vision Subnet SN44 Validator Update

Last week, Score pushed a validator update to the bounding box scoring logic, making evaluations more robust and fair.

Here’s what’s new 🔽

✅ More accurate multi-step CLIP-based classification for football detection
✅ Better handling of person-related classes
✅ Stricter penalties for irrelevant object types
✅ Adjusted area-based scaling to discourage overly large bounding boxes
✅ New accuracy threshold: bbox score < 0.2 now gets a speed score of 0

UEL Semi-Final: Bodø/Glimt vs Tottenham

Glimt controlled 58% possession and dominated key areas in the first leg, but walked away two goals down. Possession isn’t everything - only the score counts in the end.

Can they pull off a comeback in front of their home crowd?

Shot of the Week! 💥

Just before half time, Julio Enciso laced it from distance and watched the ball kiss the bar before finding the back of the net, leaving the keeper no chance. A brilliant goal that brought Ipswich back into the game.

Safe to say, Ipswich fans will be watching that one on repeat.

Bittensor Subnet 44 Validator Hotfix Update

We’ve released a new validator update to improve stability and fairness across the network. If you're running a validator, make sure to update as soon as possible.

Here’s what’s changing 🔽

✅ Max Processing Time Capped at 15s
- Slow hotkeys (e.g. 200s) were skewing speed score normalization
- Any response >15s now gets a speed score of 0
- Speed score normalization now uses the lesser of 15s or the observed max

✅ Unresponsive Hotkeys Penalized
- Previously, some hotkeys stayed active despite being unresponsive for up to 72h
- Now, a timeout = empty response = score penalty

These changes improve the fairness of the scoring system and ensure that only responsive, efficient validators are rewarded. $TAO

Community Scout – Arda Güler

The Turkish talent hasn’t played much this season, but when he does, he delivers. Per 90, he creates chances, hits the target, and finds his teammates just like the best in Madrid’s midfield. Sharp, creative, and efficient.

Star in the making?

Precision, awareness, and technique at its finest. 🔽

Score is expanding rapidly and we’re happy to welcome Sam (@sirubi_eth) as our new Content Writer!

With a deep curiosity sparked by Bitcoin and the 2017 ICO boom, Sam has spent the past decade exploring how blockchain can reshape finance, data, and systems of power. He has worked across various Web3 projects, writing on everything from decentralised finance and money to interoperability and tokenised real-world assets. With a solid grasp of financial systems, macroeconomics, and their intersection with crypto, Sam has a knack for breaking down complex ideas and uncovering their broader societal implications, translating them into clear, accessible narratives for a broad audience.

Combining deep Web3 expertise, sharp storytelling, and a lifelong passion for football, Sam is a natural fit to help shape Score’s voice. He connected immediately with the mission to democratise elite sports data and now plays a key role in articulating Score’s broader vision: building the decentralised computer vision layer for AI, starting with football and expanding far beyond the pitch.

A word from Sam:
 “I’ve come to believe that decentralisation is key to increasing access, enabling scale, and democratising critical systems, whether it’s money, finance, or intelligence. That’s what drew me to Score. As a football fan, I’ve seen how data is transforming the sport, yet access remains locked behind paywalls and elite infrastructure. Score changes that. By decentralising computer vision, it puts powerful tools in the hands of every club, making the game more open, competitive, and dynamic.
But the vision goes far beyond football. Score is building foundational infrastructure to unlock visual intelligence across sports, industries, and entirely new domains. I’m proud to be part of a team that’s not just building cutting-edge technology, but doing it in a way that empowers more people to participate, compete, and innovate.”

Coppa Italia Final: Milan vs Bologna

Just five days ago, Milan beat Bologna 3–1 in Serie A. Now they meet again - with silverware on the line.

Milan leads the cup in goals per game (3.3), Bologna in shots on target (6).

Revenge or repeat in Rome? 🏆

La Liga: Espanyol vs FC Barcelona

With 92 goals and nearly 95 xG across home and away matches, Barca is just one win away from the title. Espanyol has lost three games straight and sits near the bottom in both goals and xG.

Will tonight crown the champions? 🏆

Score is excited to welcome Kacper as our new Social Media Manager!

Kacper brings over four years of hands-on experience in Web3, crypto, e-commerce, and AI, working with early-stage startups, high-growth ventures, and established tech teams. Throughout his career, he’s led the growth of social media accounts from 0 to 200k+ followers and managed communities of over 100k members, driving engagement and building loyal user bases across fast-moving, digital-native ecosystems.

From growing his own Web3 projects to helping startups and established projects scale in the crypto and AI space, Kacper witnessed firsthand how attention, trust, and clarity make or break a project. This experience makes him a powerful addition to the Score team as we level up our social and community efforts and bridge the worlds of football, data, and decentralised tech.

A word from Kacper:
"Web3 and AI are full of bold ideas - but not all of them solve real problems.

After years of working in this space, you learn to see past the hype. Score Vision isn’t another dashboard with fancy numbers. It’s a decentralised computer vision framework that tackles one of football’s biggest bottlenecks: access to high-quality analytics.

Football is a global game, but access to advanced analytics has been limited to the top clubs. Score fixes that. This isn’t just a better tool - it’s a paradigm shift. Score allows every club, scout, and analyst to see the game deeper, faster, and smarter.

That’s the kind of change I want to be part of."

Grealish leads the FA Cup in chances created (18). Eze is second in goals scored.

Both play on the left wing and were key in helping their teams reach the final.

Winning Metrics: How xG is calculated ⚽️

This stat is everywhere in modern football, from post-match debates to scouting reports - but what goes into the numbers?

Let’s break down the key factors behind this game-changing metric. ⬇️

[1/6] 🧵

For instance, penalties have an average xG of around 0.8 because they’re very likely to be scored.

They’re taken from close range with no defenders, making them one of the easiest and most reliable ways to score, around 4 out of every 5 go in.

xG models consider a wide range of inputs to assess the quality of a chance, including:

- Distance to goal
- Angle the shot is taken from
- Type of shot (foot, header)
- Goalkeeper’s position
- Number and position of defenders
- Context of play (open play, set-piece)

Want to understand xG in even more detail?

Read the full article here:

Introducing Winning Metrics - Edition #01: xG

xG, xG, xG, you hear it everywhere, but what is it❓️

How is it calculated? Is it reliable? What are its limitations?

Find out in the first edition of our new series 🔽

xG allows scouts and analysts to evaluate players more accurately. It shows which players can score from low xG chances, and which ones regularly waste big opportunities with high xG.

The numbers tell a deeper story than goals alone.

Statistical models analyze various factors by comparing each shot to thousands of similar situations found in historical data.

The result is a probability score, an xG value, which ranges from 0 to 1. This score indicates how likely it was for the shot to result in a goal.

We're excited to announce that @dsvfund has invested $100K OTC into @webuildscore, forming a strategic partnership between two entities aligned on $TAO's long-term vision and ethos.

Score is building real-time video intelligence on Bittensor through Subnet 44, creating Vision-as-a-Service that transforms raw video into actionable insights. Starting with sports, where 90-minute football matches can be processed and labeled in under 3 seconds, the model scales across industries.

"We first met the Score team at TOKEN2049 in Dubai, and it quickly became clear they weren't just building another AI tool. They've got a sharp product, a tight vision, and a real plan to turn Subnet 44 into a commercial powerhouse," said DSV.

As Subnet 44 opens up to other verticals, it provides the infrastructure layer to become the optic nerve for AI, supporting the development of human-level AI and beyond.

"Siam and Mark bring exactly the kind of strategic thinking we need as we scale Score," said Nigel Grant  co-founder and Score's CSO. "They understand the Bittensor ecosystem deeply and share our long-term vision for what decentralized AI can achieve. This partnership gives us the strategic support to navigate the complexities of building on $TAO while staying focused on our mission."

The partnership reflects DSV's visionary approach under @SiamKidd and @markcreaser's leadership, plus their understanding of navigating the $TAO & dTAO ecosystem, both the challenges and opportunities. 

This represents a bridge between aligned entities committed to the long-term, positive-sum game that $TAO's core values represent.

Looking ahead, Score is expanding beyond Subnet 44 as we train our Object Value Function model across other subnets and prepare to introduce new tasks to our miners pool. 

This growth reflects our commitment to building infrastructure that serves the entire Bittensor ecosystem.

You can hear more about this vision when our CEO Maxime (@mxmsbt) speaks at @proofoftalk in Paris on panels next month about owning subnets and collective intelligence.

Winning Metrics: xA in Scouting

Traditional metrics like goals, assists and even xG only tell part of the story.

Many players consistently create high-quality chances, but go unnoticed by scouts if teammates fail to finish them.

That’s where xA comes in. 🔽
[1/8] 🧵

xA doesn’t just surface talent - it surfaces context.

It shows who’s creating but going unnoticed. Who fits a system. Who’s delivering the right passes, even when teammates don’t finish the job.

These 5 names weren’t obvious at the time. xA made them visible.

xA measures the likelihood that a given pass will result in a goal, regardless of whether it actually does.

The world is drowning in video, from sports to surgery, but machines still can’t see. Old-school annotation is slow & pricey. 

Enter Score ‘Subnet as a Service’, the optic nerve for AI that converts raw footage into real-time, structured data.

1/10 🧵🔽

Real-time annotation is the breakthrough. Subnet 44 is fast enough for live coaching insights, in-play betting & dynamic overlays. 

Soon the same for other verticals like robots & healthcare devices that must react to now, not yesterday.
The long-term vision: a universal value function that scores any motion on video, whether a striker’s pass or a drone’s flight, laying foundations for real-world AGI.

That engine is now plug-and-play. Upload video → get clean JSON. 

No labeling army, no GPU farm, just a decentralised network paid strictly for performance.
No crypto hurdle: fiat payments are coming. Upload → pay → receive structured insight. Decentralisation under the hood, seamless UX on top.

Score began on the football pitch. Its Bittensor Subnet 44 chops matches into 30-sec clips and leverages AI miners to tag players, ball & keypoints. 

One clip done in 2 s—> 1,000× faster than humans and conventional methods, with zero bespoke hardware.
Why it works: distributed compute on #Bittensor  incentives for accuracy -> every labeled frame improves the whole net, compounding speed and precision.

🇵🇹 Portugal
Portugal is clinical in both boxes – 2.83 goals scored and just 1.5 conceded per 90.

They dominate the midfield too: 10.62 tackles and 41.62 ball recoveries per match. A well-balanced, efficient side.

Nations League Semi-Final: Portugal vs Germany

Kimmich and Bruno Fernandes are the creative hubs of their teams. Kimmich has 21 chances created and 5 assists, while Bruno has 20 chances created and 2 assists. Both will play a big part today.

How PSG Evolved into a Treble-Winning Machine ⚙️

PSG used to rely on stars to win games. This season, they played as a team - and it worked.

🇩🇪 Germany

Germany focused on control and structure – fewest goals conceded (1.6), strong ball recoveries (39.5), and 11.25 shots on target per 90.

With only 6.38 dribbles per 90, they relied more on shape and efficiency than individual creativity.

🇪🇸 Spain

Spain were the most aggressive going forward – 3.29 goals per 90 and a tournament-high 12 shots on target per match.

But that attacking approach left gaps: 2.6 goals conceded per 90 and the fewest tackles of the four teams. Risk vs reward in full effect.

🇫🇷 France
France combined creativity with control – creating 13.75 chances and averaging 11 shots on target per 90.

They also had the highest ball recovery rate (46.0) among the 4 sides. A team that builds pressure and thrives off winning it back fast.

Each team brings a different approach – from defensive structure to high-tempo attacking play.

Winning Metrics #04: xThreat

Not every pass is equal. Some moves create chaos before the shot ever happens.

We break down xThreat (Expected Threat) - the stat that measures how teams create danger before the assist.

Let’s explore the art of progression 🔽
1/9🧵

It’s the stat that spots the pre-assisters and pattern disruptors:

 ⚡️Doku – elite dribble-driven xT
 🎯TAA – line-splitting passer
 ⚙️Rodri – the silent tempo-setter
 🔁Ángelino – overlap machine
 🧠De Bruyne – architect before the assist

🔍 How xT works:

Imagine the pitch as a probability heatmap.
Each zone is assigned a goal likelihood.

A pass from zone A to zone B adds xThreat if B is more dangerous than A.

➡️ 0.01 to 0.07? That move added 0.06 xT.

xG tells you who finishes.
xA tells you who assists.
But xThreat?

It tells you who moves the game forward - before the final pass is even made.

It’s how a dribble, carry, or vertical pass shifts the pitch in your favour.

Still, xT completes the attacking trinity:

xG = finish
xA = final pass
xT = the storm before the strike

Use it to find the players who start the fire, not just those who fan the flames. 🔥

Here’s why teams love xT:

- Maps where danger starts
- Highlights tactical launch zones
- Reveals buildup fingerprints
- Helps analysts and scouts see the system behind the stats

⚠️ But xT isn’t perfect.

 It doesn’t see:
 – Off-ball runs
 – Positional rotations
 – What happens after the ball hits a danger zone

And it rewards completed actions, even sloppy ones.

Use it with context.

xT captures impact before the highlight.

Think:
- Rodri threading a vertical ball
- Vinícius breaking lines off the dribble
- Doku dragging defenders with chaos runs

Even without a shot or assist, threat was created.
